properties.name: 3103 Eads Avenue: My Home
properties.description: Posted by Chandler09 This is where my mother and sisters moved after my parents finalized their divorce. It was a challenge because our first house was in a better part of the city culturally, economically, and socially. This house is located in midtown Saint Louis.

properties.name: 731 South Plymouth Court
properties.description: Posted by Chandler09 This is my dormitory at Columbia College Chicago. Columbia College and it is located in the South Loop of Chicago. Living in the dormitories has had a profound impact on me. It is a place where people from different backgrounds and social groups come together to live as a unit.

properties.name: Beauvais Manor
properties.description: Posted by Chandler09  Beauvais Manor was the Alzheimer Center where my grandmother lived a few years before she passed away.

properties.name: Cathedral School
properties.description: Posted by Chandler09  Cathedral School was a Catholic school located in the Central West End. It was one of the only Catholic schools in St. Louis where the majority of the students were black.

properties.name: Chris Cahill
properties.description: Posted by Chandler09 This is where a family friend of mine died. Chris Cahill was my sister\'s first like for real boyfriend. He was always around the house, just a very sweet and funny guy. He commited suicede about a month maybe less before my sister went of to college. This event really stuck out for me in my life because Chris was one of those kids who had the world going for him. He was smart and creative and so forth and yet he still felt like dying. He was supposed to attend The Art Institute of Chicago.

properties.name: Church
properties.description: Posted by Chandler09 This is the church that I was baptized in and that I was an active member of when I was a a little younger. What is interesting about this church is that they are a little more liberal and have modernized the Catholic Church service much more than other churches in the area. It was interesting going to school and to church on Fridays at a much more strict Catholic instituion and then comparing my experiences there at my own congregation.

properties.name: Clayton High School
properties.description: Posted by Chandler09 This is the high school that I graduated from. It is located in Clayton, Missouri which is a county of St. Louis. I came to Clayton High when I was sophmore in high school. I had previously attended an all-girls catholic school, therefore this public school was a complete change for me. Clayton was a very diverse and liberal institution.

properties.name: Club Rio
properties.description: Posted by Chandler09 This is a teen club located directly across the river in East St. Louis also known as "The East Side". The East Side has a totally different atmosphere than St. Louis, it resembles a ghost town. The area is dark and gloomy and it is a very dangerous place. But alot of teens from St. Louis go there to party because the area is technically in Illinois and the laws there are a little less strict than St. Louis, and also because there are not that many 18 and up clubs in the St. Louis area.

properties.name: El Caribe Real Resort
properties.description: Posted by Chandler09

properties.name: First Car Crash!!!
properties.description: Posted by Chandler09 This is the location of my first car crash. I was sixteen years old and it was literally the second day that I had driven my new car. I was driving on this expressway in St. Louis on my way to school on a Winter day. The expressway was very slippery and my tires were not getting god traction therefore my car spun out of control and slammed into a barrier. The year before this two students from my school had

properties.name: First Concert !!
properties.description: Posted by Chandler09 This where I went to my first concert without parents. I was twelve years old. The concert that I wen to was called the Scream Tour and the artists performing were Bow Wow and B2K. I really thought that I was cool.

properties.name: First Encounter with Racism
properties.description: Posted by Chandler09 When I was about twelve, my mother took our family to Gulf Shores for vacation. When we arrived there I was surprised to see how racist the people were. Confederate flags blatantly hung up, they even sold confederate flag beach towels and swimsuits in the souvenir stores. My parents are both from the north. My mom is from Queens, New York. My father is from Chicago therefore I never really had gotten to see racism first hand and so out in the open.

properties.name: Gay Pride
properties.description: Posted by Chandler09 The South Grand area of St. Louis near where I live has a large gay community. The Gay Pride Parade that takes place each year is on Grand Avenue and it ends at Tower Grove Park. The Grand neighborhood in general is very diverse, also many immigrants live here.

properties.name: My Cousin's House
properties.description: Posted by Chandler09 My cousins life in a city called Yorkville. It is about a forty-five minute drive from downtown Chicago. I thought it was always interesting to compare their worldview and perceptions of others to my own because they were from a small town and did not live in the city.

properties.name: My Grandmother's House
properties.description: Posted by Chandler09  My gradmother on my father\'s side lives on a farm in a fairly rural area of Illinois. They own a nice piece of land that my grandmother and grandfather live off of in the country.

properties.name: Pulled Over by a Cop
properties.description: Posted by Chandler09 This is exactly where I was pulled over by a police officer, nit because I had done anything wrong but because he wanted my number. What he didn\'t know was that my mother was a former board member of the St. Louis police commission. The officer was fired immediately after.

properties.name: Rock Hill Rockets
properties.description: Posted by Chandler09 This is the location where I ran select track for a summer. My team was called the Rock Hill Rockets. We were a pretty unknown team but there were some very strong runners. That year I placed third in the long jump in my state and qualified for the junior Olympics in New Orleans.

properties.name: Schnuck's
properties.description: Posted by Chandler09Schnuck\'s is the grocery store in the St. Louis area that I would steal bubblegum from as a child when my mom was checking out because she would never buy it for me

properties.name: St. Louis
properties.description: Posted by Chandler09 St. Louis is where I was born. It is an interesting place to be born in, because it is very segregated. Not necessarily racially but by economic status. The majority of the city is poor to middle class and the counties that surround the city are increasingly more wealthy as you move farther west.

properties.name: St. Louis Children's Hospital
properties.description: Posted by Chandler09 This is where I was born on July 11, 1991. I was born on the day of a solar eclipse. My middle name is Ciel which means sky in French to commemorate that moment. I was born with a heart murmur, so I spent a lot of time as a young child at this hospital.

properties.name: Tantrum Woman's Boutique
properties.description: Posted by Chandler09 This is the location of my first real job. This experience allowed me to understand the ins and outs of the retail industry. During my time working here I also became very interested in the relationship between boutique owners and management.

properties.name: The Muny
properties.description: Posted by Chandler09 The Muny is the largest outdoor theater in the nation that is located in Forest Park. I have worked at the Muny for the past three seasons of shows. Some of my favorite shows have been Aida, Miss Saigon, Fiddler on the Roof, and A Chorus Line.

properties.name: The St. Louis Galleria
properties.description: Posted by Chandler09 The St. Louis Galleria also known as the "Gally" is located in the middle of St. Louis and sort of merges the county and the city together. Recently in the efforts ti improve our public transportation, the metrolink was expanded to the Galleria. People in thee county have complained that this move has brought more crime and danger from the inner city to the area.

properties.name: Villa Duchesne
properties.description: Posted by Chandler09 Villa Duchesne High School was the all-girls catholic school that I attended from seventh grade till my first year in high school. It was a very strict school when it came to rules and regulations and learning. But also when it came to how you are. You were required to uphold the identity of the Sacred Heart woman, which is the Society of the Sacred Heart, a sisterhood established by Saint Rose Philipene Duchesne.

properties.name: Westminister Place House
properties.description: Posted by Chandler09 This is the house that I grew up in. The house where I lived when my parents were still married. This house is located in the Central West End, which is an up and coming area of St. Louis where primarily young, upper-class, and liberal families live. This area had a profound effect on my mindset and my perception of others.
